reviews.review: Still an amazing game! While the graphics have definitely aged, they still look good, and the game play is amazing.  If you are debating between this and Black Mesa(the remake), do both! They both are good in their own right.

Half-Life was one of the original pioneers in the world of first person shooters. Instead of finding your usual shooting gallery game, you'll be encountering just as many puzzles and mazes as you do combat scenarios.
Also, if you don't like cutscenes, don't worry. You won't be getting many of those in this one.

Half-Life is an fps sci-fi action game created as Valve's debut game in 1998 using a heavily modified Quake engine called GoldSrc. As someone who had played 11 hours of the game and never got past Office Complex, I recently decided to pick the game back up and, to my surprise, it holds up really well. It (along side every other Valve game pre-2020) are basically essential owning if you have a Steam account.
Final verdict: Is good, get now

Half-Life первая игра от Valve вышедшая в 1998 году. В эту игру интересно играть даже в 2021 году! Сюжет хороший рассказывающий историю о исследовательском научном комплексе " Чёрная меза " от лица доктора Гордона Фримена. Есть сетевые сервера на которых можно убивать других игроков. Графика для 1998 года очень хорошая! Мне игра понравилась и вам я её советую купить и скачать. Но перед игрой отключите HD текстуры потому что они ужасны.,

Wow I finally played Half-Life.

In our modern age playing a game this old and steeped in so much history it can almost feel like examining a historical artifact. A person who enjoys games going back to Half-Life is akin to someone into movies going and watching Citizen Kane. In this case I can say with certainty that the homework was damn fine.

What modern gaming has taken away from this game is a long list but suffice to say this game is good of course it's good. The pacing is excellent up through Xen which yeah it's Xen it's not great everyone knows it sucks compared to the rest of the game and Interloper is just ridiculous but it doesn't destroy the experience. 

Surface tension is just one set piece after another of radical goldsource fps action and it's all interspersed with crouch jumping, pushing crates and sweet sweet button pressing action. God I love pressing buttons and turning valves and shit in these games makes me feel good.

Play it and gain some of that sick gamer cred. 

Pro-tip for the wise if you're gonna do widescreen you're gonna want to bump up that fov to like 106 though I prefer 115 toss default_fov 115 in the console and bam.

Este jogo é simplesmente perfeito (claro com algumas proporções em relação aos gráficos e o sistema cabível na época, pois revolucionou a era dos FPS), a história e a jogabilidade faz com que o jogo seja imersivo e te traga muitas horas de game play, o jogo independente da época trará um público curioso pela estória e para saber como foi os primóridios do CS, um dos maiores e melhores jogos de todos os tempos.

good game

This game did not age well. The three headed monster, or the tentacle thing inside the silo, that's when the game started going down hill for me. Had to continuously throw grenades of the monster would pretty much one shot you. Controls are way too sensitive so good luck turning and jumping without falling off a ledge or hitting something electrical. Then things are buggy, like when I get on the elevator after turning on the power in the level POWER UP, then two seconds after getting on the elevator I would instantly die. Or, ON A RAIL, you have to jump over a box so that you can run up a flight of stairs. Yeah, I can't jump over it. I assumed I had to jump over it, and then I watched a YouTube video just to be sure. I sat here for a couple minutes just trying to jump over a box and I couldn't do it. Tried jumping while hugging the box, tried jumping with a running start. Tried looking up while jumping.

All in all, I'm glad I bought this game as a bundle for only $6, because I am highly disappointed

I just can't get behind it, and this really pains me to say because I ABSOLUTELY loved HL2 and it's episode expansions (HL2 is also one of my favorite games of all time too, I played it like religiously on my old 360 when I was in 6th grade). I understand how revolutionary HL1 was for the FPS genre and I really respect it for that. But the game is really showing its age imo. I was really into HL1 when I first started it and played through the first few chapters (especially when you first got the HEV suit and that catchy theme started to play) but once I reached about close to mid way in, I just couldn't play it anymore.

Aside from the large and confusing environments (that barely give you any indication on where to go), the terrible platforming (I can't tell you how many times I died by falling off of a ladder because Gordon just wouldn't cling to it properly from a jump), that dreadful section with the green 3 tentacle monster (this part can burn in hell, the sneaking mechanics didn't even work properly), the terrible enemy placement (There's literally a section where you're going up on a lift and 3 soldiers begin to immediately shoot at you without warning, and you can't even properly take cover during this section. This was pretty much it for me.),and just the extreme difficulty in general (I was playing on normal and would get destroyed in most fights, and the fights I would survive I would be low on health. And I felt like the soldiers were just too op. Not only would they always be super alert to you to the point where you'll literally come around a corner and they'll fire at you instantly, but they would also hit you with perfect aim 90% of the time too. Hell, they can even one hit kill you with a grenade. They would also usually charge at you too and rush you. At that point, you would just have to pray and hope you'll kill them before they kill you.).

So yeah, I just couldn't get behind HL1. And that really saddens me because like I said above, I really loved its sequels.

To really understand the appeal of this game you would have to be an FPS gamer in the 1990s.  The genre was very simple back then. Pick up key, open door, blow up monsters.  Half life put a new spin on things introducing NPC's, unique weapons and enviroments, and making the game more about just "shooting stuff"

It took me nearly 8 years but I finally played through all of this game.
It's pretty neat, especially for how old it is. There's a lot of times you have to think outside of the box to find some creative solutions to the puzzles given to the player. I don't really like the last 4 chapters, the atmosphere from the black mesa labs is really unparalleled against the platforming heavy alien world of Xen, it feels like these last chapters were rushed and the developer team couldn't flesh it out to its potential like they did with black mesa. Overall, a nice experience, it's absolutely a classic.

Half-Life is an amazing game, like really good. It isn't as good as people say, but its still amazing. Why I say it isn't as good people say is because there are a couple issues I have with the game, the issues I have with the game are the game doesn't do the best at directing you the direction you need to go to progress, and Xen, its not as fun as Black Mesa and the surface, but its still kinda fun. Other than those two things the game is amazing and you won't regret purchasing it.
